result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin C Kimmel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin C Kimmel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:30pm. 
Defendant Benjamin C Kimmel in court, in custody, with Attorney Corey Montiho.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Hall veriifies victim rights compliance. 
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall.
The victim, L.K., makes a statement. 
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Montiho.  Attorney Montiho submits two letters of support for Mr. Kimmel.

The Court sentences Mr. Kimmel to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Work-Release but not other Huber-type privileges such as child care or treatment; to commence forthwith
--35 days credit for time already served given
The Court notes that the court-costs have been paid in full.  The Court takes under advisement the issue of whether the Court should order as part of its Sentence the payment of outstanding DOC supervision fees in the amount of $450.  Counsel are to file any letter briefs on this, or any statement of fact that would obviate the Court to make a ruling on this, by 2/24/17 .

Attorney Montiho requests that the Court grant a day-furlough for Mr. Kimmel to attend the funeral of a family friend on February 11th. 
The Court denies this request. 
recess 2:12pm.
Adjustment Number: 17A 016568, Payable Number: 138759, Receipt Number: 17R 000777, Amount: $20.00
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 3:38pm [mo]
Defendant Benjamin C Kimmel in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Mr. Kimmel indicates that he does not wish to have counsel
--The Court concludes that Mr. Kimmel is competent to represent himself

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with Lori Kimmel or the juvenile T.R.M. (dob 3/31/1999)
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

Mr. Kimmel enters a plea of "No Contest"

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Mr. Kimmel submits a letter re: parenting classes

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 9 months, with conditions:
--pay statutory costs 
--provide DNA sample to designee

recess: 3:56pm
